content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Understand Context and System Variables

Context variables let your bot gather customer information regardless of channel. System variables store back-end information about conversations.

Context Variables

Context variables create dynamic mappings between Salesforce objects and the channel that your customer uses to interact with your bot. We provide prebuilt context variables that allow admins to look up contacts regardless of channel and then access any related objects.

Salesforce provides these prebuilt context variables:

* Chat Key: The session ID of the chat transcript.
* Contact Id: Use the Contact Id to find out when the chatting customer is a known contact.
* End User Id: In the Bot Builder, use the End User Id to find information about the customer chatting with your bot.
* Routable Id: If youâ€™re using a pre-chat form in embedded Chat, use Routable Id to access the LiveChatTranscript record for the current bot session.

Custom Context Variables

Custom context variables help the bot use the information it learns throughout a conversation. You can map custom context variables to custom fields on a prechat form to customize the conversation, or use the incoming Messaging phone number to look up a contact.

System Variables

Salesforce provides these system variables:

* Referrer Bot Id: In bot-to-bot transfers, this field shows the ID of the bot that initiated the transfer.
* Last Customer Input: The string of text the customer input most recently.

Context and System Variables in Merge Fields

You can use context and system variables in bot messages with merge syntax.
title: Understanding Context Variables and System Variables in Service Cloud
